Democrats countered that the law is already benefiting millions of Americans and should not be derailed. Because of the Affordable Care Act, Americans no longer have to live in fear that insurance companies will drop or cap their coverage if they get sick, or that they'll face double-digit premium increases with no accountability or recourse, Barack Obama said.
